PokerProject

Class Player

  • Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends Object
    Class Player represents the player of Video Poker.

    Each object has two Integer:

    • initBal - initial balance of the player;
    • credits - player's current available money.

    And also an array Card which represents the player's hand (5 cards).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(int initial)
      Constructor specifying one Integer: the initial balance of the player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int initial)
        Constructor specifying one Integer: the initial balance of the player. Note that the initial balance and the current available money is equal in the beginning of the game.
        Parameters:
        initial - Integer associated to the initial balance of the player

    • Method Detail

      • getCredits

        public int getCredits()
        Gets the current money of the player.
        Returns:
        player's current credits.

      • getInitBal

        public int getInitBal()
        Gets the initial balance of the player.
        Returns:
        player's initial balance.

      • getHand

        public Card[] getHand()
        Gets the current hand of the player (5 cards).
        Returns:
        array of Card with player's hand.

      • getHandStr

        public String getHandStr()
        Returns the current hand of the player (5 cards) as a String (example: "7D AH 3C 8H KS").
        Returns:
        String with the 5 cards which correspond to the player's hand.

      • incCredits

        public void incCredits(int creditsToAdd)
        Increments to the current credit of the player the value given as input. If it is a negative value, the current credit is decremented by that value.
        Parameters:
        creditsToAdd - money to add to player's credits.

      • newHand

        public void newHand(Deck deck)
        Sets a new hand (5 cards) for the player. Five cards are added to the array of Card by using the function draw() from Deck. The five first cards from the shuffled deck are used as the player's initial hand.
        Parameters:
        deck - set of available cards to draw.

      • holdCards

        public void holdCards(int[] holdArray,
                      Deck deck)
        Sets player's hand after hold. The player decides which cards to hold from the initial hand. Those cards are maintained and new ones are drawn for replacing the ones not held.
        Parameters:
        holdArray - array of Integer with the indexes of the cards the player chose to hold.
        deck - set of available cards to draw.
